title: What is the point of ranked when you get matched by MMR anyways?
body:
Let me start by saying this is not a salt post about the ranked system.  I am fine with my placement because I know I will climb easily enough.  It is a simple question.  Why does the system place me in Silver 3 after going 8-2 in placements and then match me with high gold and low platinum anyways?  What is the point of having ranked when the system doesn't even recognize someone's rank when placing them in a ranked game?  It seems the only thing they look at when selecting teams is MMR and rank is totally irrelevant.

Here is a list of rankings I have been matched with in my past 4 ranked games.  Note that I am currently silver 1.

Silver 1: 1
Gold 5: 3
Gold 4: 2
Gold 3: 8
Gold 2: 12
Gold 1: 5
Plat 5: 4
Plat 4: 1

If the game matches games based only on MMR and rank is so meaningless then why not just remove ranked and tell everyone their MMR?

----------------------------------------------

Edit:  I just did some math and according to that, my MMR places me at gold 3 with 75 ladder points.

1x1/36+2x3/36+3x2/36+4x8/36+5x12/36+6x5/36+7x4/36+8x1/36 = 4.75

This is also what https://na.op.gg/summoner/userName=AlienPrimate places me at.

----------------------------------------------

Edit 2:  I went duo with someone else who was in silver 2 and started getting matched with high silver/low gold.  I was still getting 27-28 LP for wins and losing 13-14 for losses.  This means that it makes absolutely no difference who you are matched with for how much LP you gain or lose.

I feel the exact opposite. 
As if my elo isn't already hell enough i don't see why i have to grind 15 games per division thanks to this fucked up promo system just to finally rank up and then get mixed with lower players anyways

That's why i get so discouraged from playing only ranked. It's too much of a grind, if you're not in the top 10%. Diamond 1+ players don't really experience a grind since they basically start out in plat 1 no matter what and even if they didn't it's not like them going on win streaks is going to force them to play against people with a lot more skill. It's a grind because people who belong in plat, gold, or silver are going against people in whole other divisions if they start playing well. Bronze should be able to beat bronze to get into silver, not golds or silvers. Golds should be able to beat golds to get into plat, not plats or diamonds, etc.

It's not about who you get placed against but who you get stuck with going up against them.

My promos last year into gold had me matches with me and low silvers vs mid gold to low plat players... Before you can leverage your advantage the other team has already stomped your team into oblivion (i.e. you team has someone dying at least once a min).

Even pros (Febiven said this last year as an example) say ranked is a crapshoot that is determined by how teams are divided in regards to climbing.

I've also experienced the same scenario as yours for just about every gold promo.

Something about ranked is utterly broken, or if not it's rigged. Regardless, I think ranked stinks, so I don't bother with it no more.

A matchmaking that forces you to grind hundreds if not thousands of games to cover up for "variance" when you get shafted by it and oh lord how one can get shafted endlessly, just isn't worth it.

Well the reason we have MMR as the basis for who you'd be matched with is because of this.

Say your a plat player on a new account, you start in bronze-silver or so despite how your placements went because new player's are always placed in bronze or silver never higher. So as a platinum player, you dominate the low ELO of bronze, well it would kind of suck for everyone else if they kept being placed against someone who SHOULD be platinum. So let's say you play several games and have an MMR of low platinum, now you'll be placed with platinum players and if you win those matches, you can skip up the ladder MUCH faster than normal, skipping from bronze 5-1 is entirely plausible. This makes it so that smurfs and really good player's can get out of games with newer player's faster, therefore making it less likely to make a game unbalanced in low ELO. 

Without MMR every game would give 20-25 LP randomly, making each person have to play atleast 7-8 games in each division, with MMR it's possible to get anywhere from 20-50 LP based on the MMR of the other's you've been fighting against. making it so each person only has to play 5-7 games and doesn't have to go to each division and can skip up several to get where they should be faster.

PS: Skipping works by, i believe, being 200 MMR or more above your current division and passing your promos, you'll skip 1 or more divisions.

On the other end of the spectrum you might have someone at 400 mmr go to 900 and someone at 1000 go to 1100.

With mmr who you play with and against matters the most. Basically the game gives yo odds on winning based on your team's total mmr vrs the other team's total mmr. If you oh off upsets you get more mmr. If you lose to worse team's you lose more mmr. 

Anyways that is the basics It.
